Title: Nyhamna gas outage to last until Friday: Gassco
Description: Norwegian gas grid operator Gassco expects the 79.8 million m3 per day Nyhamna gas processing plant to remain offline until Friday.
Author: JS

Title: Hungary’s MVM buys 5% stake in Azerbaijan’s Shah Deniz gas field
Description: Hungary’s state-owned power company MVM entered into a sale and purchase agreement (SPA) with the Azerbaijani state-owned Southern Gas Corridor to acquire a 5% stake in the production sharing agreement (PSA) for Shah Deniz offshore gas field in the Caspian Sea and a 4% stake in Azerbaijan Gas Supply Company, the firm responsible for the marketing and sale of natural gas produced from the field.
Author: JS

Title: Taiwan's CPC secures long-term LNG offtake from Qatar's NFE expansion, buys 5% stake
Description: State-owned QatarEnergy signed definitive agreements with Taiwan’s CPC Corporation covering the long-term supply of LNG to CPC and partnership in the 32 mtpa North Field East (NFE) LNG expansion project.
Author: JS

Title: Singapore’s EMA and Kogas sign LNG cooperation MoU
Description: Singapore’s Energy Market Authority (EMA) and South Korean energy company Kogas have signed a memorandum of understanding (MoU) to collaborate in LNG procurement and supply chain management.
Author: JS

Title: Alaska LNG inks preliminary gas sales agreement with Pantheon Resources
Description: State-owned Alaska Gasline Development Corporation (AGDC), which is developing the 20 mtpa Alaska LNG project in Nikiski, has signed a gas sales precedent agreement (GSPA) with a subsidiary of UK-based oil and gas company Pantheon Resources.
Author: JS

Title: BP’s delayed Greater Tortue Ahmeyim FLNG project receives key gas processing unit
Description: The BP-operated 2.4 mtpa Greater Tortue Ahmeyim floating LNG project offshore Senegal and Mauritius has received its floating production storage and offloading vessel, paving the way for the much-delayed project to begin gas production.
Author: CK
